Package nzilbb.ag.util

Class DefaultOffsetGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • nzilbb.util.CommandLineProgram
      • nzilbb.ag.cli.Transform
        • nzilbb.ag.util.DefaultOffsetGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function<Graph,​Graph>, UnaryOperator<Graph>, GraphTransformer
    @ProgramDescription("Generates default anchor offsets for JSON-encoded annotation graphs from stdin")
public class DefaultOffsetGenerator
extends Transform
implements GraphTransformer
    Generates default anchor offsets. These are computed using linear interpolation between certain offsets. What counts as certain depends on how defaultOffsetThreshold is set.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

      • transform

        public Graph transform​(Graph graph)
                throws TransformationException
        Generates default anchor offsets.

        Anchors with null offset, with no "confidence" attribute, or with the "confidence" attribute set to equal or below defaultOffsetThreshold, may have their offset set to a default, computed value.

        Strings of candidate anchors have their offsets set by linear interpolation between bounding anchors.

        Strings are determined by:

        • chaining annotations together by common Annotation.getStart()/Annotation.getEnd() anchors (on any layer) - e.g. words chained together with interspersed or bounding noise annotations, or
        • chaining annotations together by successive values of Annotation.getOrdinal() on a common layer and within a common parent - e.g. words within a turn, interspersed with discontinuties in the graph (i.e. pauses).

        Bounding anchors are determined by:

        • having higher "confidence" than defaultOffsetThreshold on the same layer and within a common parent - e.g. manually aligned words within a turn,
        • having higher "confidence" than defaultOffsetThreshold on a different layer and within a common parent - e.g. manually aligned utterances within a turn partition the words in that turn, and
        • being a start or end anchor of a parent defaultOffsetThreshold - e.g. a turn's start/end anchors bound the anchors of it's words.
        • or otherwise using the existing offsets of bounding candidate anchors.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface GraphTransformer
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to transform.
        Returns:
        The changes introduced by the tranformation.
        Throws:
        TransformationException - If the transformation cannot be completed.

      • main

        public static void main​(String[] argv)
        Command line interface entrypoint: reads JSON-encoded transcripts from stdin, generates default anchor offsets, and writes them to stdout.
